recommendations: When a client is pleading or distressed, start with one sincere acknowledgment (e.g., “I’m really sorry you’re going through this.”) and make this a consistent habit. Follow it immediately with a brief reassurance that you’re here to help, then move into the solution. With practice, build a reflex: empathy → reassurance → action in every emotionally charged chat.
feedback_professional_and_empathetic_ton:
["The Query: "My bro please help me. Its been 2 days still not got the account. M missing my A+ setups on gold."

Your Answer: "Allow me some time to get back to you."

Feedback: The overall tone in this chat came across as somewhat apathetic. Because the client was clearly pleading for help, it was important to respond with empathy. Even a simple line like “I’m deeply sorry to hear that you’re going through this” would have helped reassure the client and provide a sense of calm."]

recommendations: Keep responses focused on the client’s actual question. Avoid re-explaining processes they’ve already completed. Always verify key timestamps (last trade, agreement signed) from the API and give the exact next step or timeframe, such as the 72-hour KYC window. Make sure to use short, direct updates to prevent confusion.
feedback_clear_and_logical_communication:
["Here, you over-explained the entire Phase 2 and agreement-signing process even though the client had already signed their agreement on 12/11/2025 and had taken their last trade on 11/11/2025. 

Last Trade: https://prnt.sc/oT4Kpu8Flg_p
Agreement Signing Done: https://prnt.sc/Bcb3y7OhpGWW
GTG by RM: https://prnt.sc/QiN4o1FR5huK

All you needed to do was confirm the signing date and inform them that KYC verification takes up to 72 hours. The additional walkthrough about Phase 2 requirements, pop-ups, and the agreement flow was unnecessary and added confusion instead of clarity.

Correction: "Sorry for the confusion. Typically, KYC Verification takes upto 72 hours to complete. Since you signed your agreement on 12/11/2025, kindly wait for the mentioned timeframe to receive an update on your FundedNext Account.""]

recommendations:
Whenever you chat with a client, your first step should always be to check their account before responding. If you had checked this account first, the client’s question would have been clear and you could have raised the correct ticket to PSTF. 

Make it a habit: check the account → understand the issue → then respond.
feedback_operational_diligence:
["The client could not reset his account and mentioned that it was not "giving him the possibility." This indicated that the reset option was not available for some reason.

After looking into the API, it could be seen that the account had been deleted due to inactivity. This required a ticket creation and escalation to PSTF.

SS: https://prnt.sc/pdFYmRahLUKr"]
